She saw that it was profitable, and she decided to establish her own business.  She sells her product by order.  She sells creams, lotions, household items, necklaces, bracelets, and earrings.  She sells her product in the neighboring communities.  She leaves for work at 8:00 a.m., and she works until 5:00 p.m. 

She has requested a loan for 9,000 lempiras from ODEF.  She will use it to buy jewelry and Voque products. This way she will be able to meet the product demand that she has.  With this investment she hopes to be able to get more income and give her customers better service.

Her goal is to get ahead and for her business to grow.  This way she will be able to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy jewelery and Vogue products.

loans.name: Rosa Guadalupe

texts.es:
Rosa Guadalupe tiene 67 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 19, 17 y 15 años de edad los cuales estudian, vive con su familia en la Colonia Evita San Francisco de Yojoa, Peña Blanca.
Doña Guadalupe es una maestra jubilada la cual hace 4 años  emprendió  un negocio de venta de novedades y  recargas de celulares.  Ella estableció este negocio en su casa en el cual manifiesta que le esta yendo muy bien. Ofrece a sus clientes Productos de Belleza, Ropa, Perfumes y adicional vende útiles Escolares. Doña Guadalupe es una mujer muy trabajadora pues esta muy motivada desde que se dedica a su propio negocio en el cual genera sus propios ingresos para ayuda r en su hogar con los gastos que a diario se presentan. Además de dedicarse a esta actividad de vender estos productos, realiza también trabajos de costura. Dedica todo el día a su negocio.
En al actualidad solicito su Segundo préstamo de 22,000 lempiras los cuales invertirá en comprar mas productos de novedades, como productos de belleza para surtir mas su negocio y poder ofrecer variedad de producto a los clientes e incrementar su inventario. 
Su meta es ampliar mas su negocio, mantenerlo siempre surtido y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa Guadalupe, age 67, is married and has three children, ages 19, 17, and 15.  The children go to school.  She lives with her family in the Evita San Francisco neighborhood in Yojoa, Peña Blanca.

Guadalupe is a retired teacher.  Four years ago she undertook a business of selling novelty items and electronic loads for cell phones.  She established this business in her house, and she states that it is going very well for her.

She sells beauty products, clothes, perfumes, and school supplies.  Guadalupe is a very hard-working woman.  She has been very motivated ever since she started her own business.  She generates her own income with her business, and she uses the income to help with the daily household expenses.  In addition to this business activity of selling these products, she also does sewing jobs.  She devotes all day to her business.

She is currently requesting her second loan for 22,000 lempiras to buy novelty items and beauty products.  She will do this to stock her business more, to increase her inventory, and to be able to offer a variety of products to her customers.  Her goal is to expand her business, to keep it stocked always, and to get improved income.

loans.use: to buy novelty items, beauty products and electronic loads for cell phones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and labor cost support.

loans.name: David Peter H.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, is very pleased to present this group of primary teachers from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 16,950,000.00 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. 	

David is the leader of this group of teachers. He is 65 years old, married, and has six children, who attend primary, secondary, and tertiary institutions. He was born in Moyamba. He has been a teacher for 42 years. He is requesting a loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is a 32-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents. He has big responsibilities for his family, especially his nephew. He has been working at providing legal documentation services and has many customers visiting him to smooth their official document preparation since the year 2000. In parallel, he has owned a network since 2011. Today he wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his nephew’s university fees until graduation. He will be more than happy to see him achieve a higher educational level. In the future, he plans to focus on one job and better support his family.

loans.use: to pay his nephew’s university fees

loans.name: Letty Rufina

texts.es:
Letty es una mujer de 47 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de comida y ropa. 
Su historia empezó vendiendo comida con su hermano luego se independizaba y vende comida desde su casa adicional se dedicaba a vender ropas y solicito crédito para su negocio y otro parte para su negocio. En la actulidad su trabajo lo hace sola, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es tener mi casa terminada o lujosa. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de comida y asi comprar pollos, aliños, bebidas.
texts.en:
Letty is a 47 year old woman who has many aspirations to succeed in her sales of food and clothing in the coming years. Her story selling food began with her brother and then she became independent and now sells food from her house. In addition she sold clothing and applied for a loan for one business and also for the other.

Currently Letty works alone and faces no difficulties. She is married with children and her most important dream is to have a house that is completed and luxurious. She would like a loan for her food sales and to purchase chickens, seasoning and drinks

loans.use: to buy chickens, seasoning and drinks.

loans.name: Khadime

texts.fr:
Khadime pratique le mareyage depuis près de 16 ans. Il achète toute la production de poisson d'une ou de deux pirogues au débarquement et la revend à des détaillants installées dans les grandes villes de l'intérieur du pays.Il pratique également l'agriculture afin de diversifier ses sources de revenus.Il est marié à deux épouses et est père de 6 enfants qui vont tous à l'école française et arabe. Khadim souffre toutefois de la rareté du poisson dans sa ville. il est ainsi obligé de voyager le long de la grande côte pour se procurer le produit; ce qui demande des sommes importantes. C'est pourquoi il sollicite un prêt de 500000f pour acheter 600 kg de poisson.
 Son ambition est d'acquérir ses propres pirogues et un véhicules frigorifique pour mieux écouler la production.
texts.en:
Khadime has been in the fish trade for nearly 16 years. He buys the whole catch from 1 or 2 canoes when they unload their fish, and resells it to retailers located in the large towns of the country's interior. Khadime also farms, in order to diversify his sources of revenue. He is married to 2 women and father to 6 children, who all go to the French-Arab school.

Khadime's town is, however, suffering from a shortage of fish. He is therefore forced to travel along the extensive coastline to obtain the product, something which requires important sums of money. This is why he is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs to buy 600 kg of fish. His ambition is to buy his own canoes and a refrigerated vehicle so that he can better move and sell his goods.

loans.use: to buy 600 kg of fish.

loans.name: Celsa Eveling

texts.es:
Celsa, de 35 años de edad, casada madre de un hijo 8 años de edad. Estudio una carrera técnica de contabilidad, pero ella desde siempre le ha gustado todo lo relacionado con las plantas y la naturaleza por tal motivo puso su negocio de Vivero forestal y plantas ornamentales  su esposo y su padre la han apoyado desde el principio lleva 4 años con este negocio además de esto también vende ropa para conseguir otros ingresos y aportar en su hogar. Esta actividad la realiza en su comunidad en las afueras de León. 

Quiere utilizar el crédito para comprar plantas , semillas de diferentes tipos de plantas . Con el objetivo de ofrecer una mejor variedad en sus plantas y flores. Pues su idea es expandir a mas de un vivero en su comunidad para promover el cuido y protección al medio ambiente y al mismo tiempo generar ingresos para las  familias.
texts.en:
Celsa, age 35, is married and has an eight year old son.  She studied the career of accounting.  However, she has always liked everything related to plants and nature.  For that reason she set up her business of a forest nursery and ornamental plants.  Her husband and her father have supported her since the beginning.  She has been in this business for four years.  She also sells clothes in order to get extra income and contribute to her household.  She conducts her business activity in her community on the outskirts of León.

She wants to use the loan to buy plants and seeds for different types of plants.  Her objective is to offer a better variety of plants and flowers.  Her idea is to expand to become more than a nursery in her community.  She wants to promote the care and protection of the environment while, at the same time, generating income for the families.

loans.use: to buy plants and seeds for different types of plants.

loans.name: Luz  Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO A”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; ella tiene 70 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende leche, azúcar, aceite, galletas y arroz, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas al por mayor.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Valle Sagrado A" [sacred valley A] communal bank. The communal bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.

This member is Luz Marina. She is 70 years old and is a widow with two children. She alternates her everyday activities with her business, which is a grocery store. She sells milk, sugar, oil, cookies and rice. Luz Marina works from 6am until 10pm. Through this business she is able to help her children get ahead. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. Luz Marina is requesting this loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies wholesale.

Luz Marina is grateful for the loan and is committed to paying her installments.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Rosa Marlene

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer de 38 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su taller de costura su historia empezó desde pequeña le lleno la atención la costura entonces decidió ser costurera, el trabajo lo hago sola, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, si tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es seguir creciendo en su taller. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su taller de costura comprando textiles, hilos, telas para su negocio.
texts.en: Rosa is a 38 year old woman and has many aspirations for the coming years of prospering with her sewing workshop. Her story began since from a young age sewing caught her attention, she decided to be a seamstress. She does the work alone and does not have difficulties. She is not married, and has children. Her biggest dream is to continue growing her workshop. For that she would like a loan for her sewing workshop buying textiles, thread and fabric for her business.

loans.use: to acquire supplies such as textiles, thread, and fabric.

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr:
Komlan est un homme âgé de 28 ans. Il est célibataire.
Komlan travaille comme revendeur de produits de quincaillerie depuis 2010. Il vend ses marchandises dans une boutique et s’approvisionne  à Lomé. 
Komlan a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des peintures, et grillages. Il veut réinvestir dans son activité afin de mieux préparer sa vie maritale.
texts.en:
Komlan is 28 years old and single.
He has been reselling hardware goods since 2010.  He stocks up in Lomé and sells in a shop.
Komlan has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy paints and metal fences.  He wants to reinvest in his activity in order to better prepare for married life.

loans.use: to buy hardware goods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy hoes and fertilizer, and pay the labourers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay his labourers.

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es: María es una mujer de 70 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de comida su historia empezó cuando fue independiente por sus hijos siempre se desempeña vendiendo comida desayunos y almuerzos, su trabajo lo hace sola, tiene dificultades son los ladrones, no está casada, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es adecuar su negocio en su local. Por eso quiere el préstamo para mejorar infraestructura del local, comprando cemento, arena, bloques e insumos y viveres para la comida que vende.
texts.en:
Maria is a 70 year old woman who has many aspirations to succeed in her food sales in the coming years. Her story began when her children became independent. She is always selling breakfasts and lunches. She works alone and has problems with thieves.

Maria is a single mother and has sons. Her most important dream is to make her business premises suitable. Consequently she would like a loan to improve the infrastructure of the space by buying cement, sand and blocks and to buy supplies and food for the meals she sells.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of the premises by buying cement, sand and blocks and to buy food supplies.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es: La señora petrona mujer esforzada y de gran valor, expresaba que con la ayuda de Dios y el apoyo que le ha brindado kiva y la micro-financiera ha podido hacerle mejoras a su vivienda en esta ocasión el destino del credito sera para la realizacion del techo del cuarto de su hija menor, haciendo uso de los siguientes materiales: zinc, perlines, golosos, soldaduras entre otros, su plan a futuro es seguir haciendole mejoras a su casa y asi tener la sastifaccion  que les dio una vivienda digna y acogedora a sus familiares.
texts.en: Sra. Petrona is an industrious woman with good values.  She says that with God's help and the support that Kiva has provided with microloans, she has been able to make improvements to her home.  On this occasion, the loan will be used to install a roof over her young daughter's room.  This would require the following materials:  zinc, crossbeams, screws, welding supplies, and other items.  Her plan for the future is to continue making improvements to her house so that she can have the satisfaction of providing a decent and comfortable home for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for installing a roof over her daughter's room.

loans.name: David Jose

texts.es:
Aparicio es un hombre de 37 años que edad, padre de 2 niños a los cuales ama mucho. Actualmente el vive en la ciudad de Nazca, lugar visitado por muchos turistas debido a las inmensas líneas trazadas en los suelos y también por la calidez y servicio de su gente.

Aparicio se dedica a brindar servicio turístico en toda la ciudad de Nazca, el labora en esta actividad un promedio de 8 horas diarias y atiende a 8 personas aproximadamente, debido a que sus turistas no solo son del exterior si no también nacionales. Él sabe que estos últimos años ha aprendido mucho de este tipo de trabajo y le ha puesto mucho empeño y dedicación al mismo, a su vez también se dedica a alquilar cuartos, lo que le permite generar un ingresos mensual.

El está muy contento por los negocios que tiene y está orgulloso del buen trabajo que viene desarrollando. Aparicio ahora tiene la idea de poder hacer algunos acabados en su casa para que así pueda mejorar su calidad de vida, sabe que ver su casa mucho más bonita lo hará sentirse en mejor ambiente y mucho más motivado junto a sus pequeños, es por este motivo que ha solicitado la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva y espera puedan confiar en él y así ayudarlo a mejorar como persona.

Aparicio sueña con mejorar el segundo piso de su vivienda y también invertir en un negocio mucho más grande.
texts.en:
Aparicio is a 37 year old man, father of 2 children whom he loves very much. Today he lives in the city of Nazca, a place visited by many tourists due to the immense lines drawn in the ground and also for the quality and service of its people.

Aparicio provides tourism services for a living and is proud of the good work being carried out. Aparicio now has the idea of being able to make some finishes on his house so that he can improve his quality of life. He knows that seeing his house much more beautiful will make him feel much more motivated in a better environment with his children. It is for this reason that he is requesting the assistance of the Kiva lenders and hopes they can confide in him and help him to improve as a person.

Aparicio dreams of improving the second floor of his housing and also investing in a much larger business.

loans.use: to do finishes on his home.

loans.name: Asyme

texts.fr: Asyme est un jeune père de famille. Il est marié et a trois enfants qui vont tous à l'école arabe.Depuis bientôt 10 ans, il tient une boutique de vente de denrées alimentaires au marché de sa localité.Il subvient ainsi  avec ses revenus aux besoins de sa petite famille et à ses propres besoins. Afin d'augmenter son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter 1 tonne de riz et 200 litres d'huile. Son ambition est d'agrandir son commerce.
texts.en:
Asyme is a young family man. He is married and has 3 children who all go to the Arab school. He has run a shop selling food products at his local market for almost 10 years. His income allows him to take care of his small family's needs, and his own.

In order to strengthen his business, Asyme is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs to buy 1 ton of rice and 200 litres of oil. His goal is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy 1 ton of rice and 200 litres of oil.

loans.name: Andres Isidoro

texts.es: Andres tiene 37 años es casado vive con la esposa, y con los hijos Andreina Nicole de 10 años y John Andres de 8 años. La ventanilla se llama CAMINANDO HACIA EL FUTURO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Jesus del Gran Poder, pertenece al canton Ventanas, se dedica a labores agricolas a mantener los cultivos de naranja, guineo, orito, cacao y café. Andres se dedica a la agricultura a cuidar las plantaciones de cacao, guineo y naranja ya que estos productos son de ciclo largo, las compras las realiza en el canton Ventanas y las vende en el mismo lugar. El credito lo solicita para la compra de insumos como: abonos, urea, podas, limpieza del terreno de las malas hiervas y evitar enfermedades en los cultivos. El credito le ayudado a incrementar la calidad de los productos y evitar pérdidas en los cultivos. El sueño de Andres es comprar un terreno, obtener mas productos y mayor produccion. Le gusta hacer deporte con su familia y amigos del barrio.
texts.en: Andres is 37; he is married and lives with his wife and two children, Andreina Nicole aged 10, and John Andres aged 8. The communal bank, ‘Caminando hacia el futuro,’ is located in the neighbourhood of Jesus del Gran Poder, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas. It is devoted to the farm work involved in maintaining the orange, banana, baby banana, cacao and coffee crops. Andres makes a living in agriculture by looking after the cacao, baby banana and orange plantations, as these products have a long farming cycle. The buying takes place in the canton of Ventanas, and they are sold in the same place. The loan has been requested to buy supplies such as fertilizers, urea and shears to clear the land of weeds and avoid diseases in the crops. The loan has helped him to improve the quality of his products and avoid loss of crops. Andres’ dream is to buy a piece of land, obtain more products and achieve higher production. He likes playing sports with his family and his friends from the neighbourhood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, urea, and shears to clear the land of weeds.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is married and has four children who attend school. He has been a rice farmer for two years. 

Jean Pierre is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy fertilizers and seeds and pay for labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get an increased output and earn more money.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and support labor costs.

loans.name: Tannous

texts.en:
Tannous is a 50-year-old married man and the father of one child. He works in selling special foods & goods through distributing them with the help of his lovely car among villages all over his region. He is a hardworking man, and he sells different goods to meet with his multiple clients' choices and habits. Its been 36 years since he started this business, and it's going on just fine.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his spring-summer merchandise with special drinks and goods requested in this season. He has already experienced Al Majmoua loans before and they had a pleasant effect on both his social and financial situations. At the same time, he was a borrower in good standing. Tannous is willing to expand his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise with special spring-summer drinks with special discounts.

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y una hija, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y tostadas de plátano y yuca, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 4 años, trabaja todos los días de 7:00am a 3:30pm, hasta la fecha no ha tenido inconvenientes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales necesarios para elaborar la venta como el maíz, leña y gas, esto es lo que le ayudara a María para continuar prestando su servicio, fortaleciéndose con lo necesario.
La aspiración de María es que a través del préstamo su negocio tenga más estabilidad, ganarse más clientes y velar por las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and a daughter; she makes tortillas, fried plantain and fried manioc to sell; she's had the business for four years and works every day from 7am until 3:30pm.  To date, she's had no inconveniences..

She's asking for a loan to buy supplies needed to make the things she sells like corn, firewood and gas.  This is what will help María continue to provide service strengthening herself with what is necessary.  María's hope is that through the loan her business will be more stable, she'll acquire more customers and will be able to take care of her home's neeeds.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and gas.

loans.name: Al-Boshra Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-BOSHRA and consists of four members who are all females: Jamila, Sameera, Bushra and Fatima. All of them are friends and from Aden, Yemen. They primarily work together in small business like sewing. The group took a loan of 120,000 YER.

Jamila, 49, (she is the second women from the left with clothes on her lap) is a married woman with two children. She has designed and sold curtains, blinds, and dresses as well as mobile phones and decorations in general, since starting her business one year ago. Initially she only took on simple designs, but as she gradually became more skilled in decorative arts, she added more value to her work. 

Currently she has clients that include important department stores. With the business she gets, she’s been able to expand her location and grow her infrastructure. The quality of her fabrics has allowed her to maintain a select clientele that usually sends her new clients. Her goal is to grow her business and position herself in the market and separate her production space from her family space to achieve tranquility. 

Jamila is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy fabric and needles in large quantities in order to get a discount, as she has orders she’ll be working on. She'll make her investment a success.

loans.use: to buy fabric and needles in large quantities for her business

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 55-year-old married man with eight adult children. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. 

He has been running a silver store for 20 years.

He is a person who has had to pass through many difficulties in his life. However, his desire to work and get ahead has permitted him to overcome them and continue to make progress in life. 

Approximately at the age of 15 years, he had to leave the municipality where he was born due to the violence, and he immigrated to the city of Taiz with the determination to continue with his life. In the city, he worked as an employee in various businesses, but seeing how poorly paid he was, he decided to become independent and open a general store. 

Currently, Mohammed is operating his small silver store, which permits him to generate the necessary income to cover his household expenses. He has very good customers, and this has caused his sales to rise in recent months. 

Currently, Mohammed faces a bad situation in economic stability, and thus he is seeking to request a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy silver for his business, in order to increase the variety of products he offers his customers. 

Mohammed hopes that his business will increase its sales considerably. He also hopes that it will keep generating the income he needs to maintain his household.

loans.use: to buy silver for his business in order to increase the variety of products he offers for customers.

loans.name: Zohair

texts.en:
Zohair is 27 years old, a married man who lives together with his wife in Sana`a,Yemen. His business is buying and selling groceries (grocery store). His store is located in his own home. He has been running his business very well and in recent years it has provided for his family. He started his business with very little working capital but, owing to his commitment, he now has a store with regular customers who provide very good references on the service that he provides which is very popular with the customers. Zohair's store is very popular with his neighbors who provide very good references for both himself and his family.

He would like to continue growing his business as he knows that he still has demands to satisfy. He would like to buy a variety of merchandise and more groceries so that he does not neglect his customers' needs. He is requesting a youth loan for 150,000 YER from AMB so that he can buy grocery items such as rice, soft drinks, mineral water and sugar, etc. that will increase his profit and thus his income.

In the future, he would like to provide his wife with a better quality of life and his future children  with a better education.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as rice, soft drinks, mineral water and sugar, etc.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is married and has four children between three and 15 years old. They all attend school. He has been a rice farmer for nine years, and would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and hire some workers to get the best possible harvest. With the profits earned from this loan, he plans to expand the area he has been farming to get more output and save money.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and hire workers.

loans.name: Jyamberemuhinzi Wa Zone 3 Group

texts.fr:
Fréderic  fait partie du groupe Jyambere Muhinzi wa Zone 3. Il a 34 ans et il est marié, avec 3 enfants de 6 mois à 8 ans, dont 2 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Fréderic est agriculteur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utilise des semences de race améliore et utilise des engrais chimique. Dans les prochaines années, Fréderic voudrait être un grand agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Frederic is a member of the Jyambere Muhinzi wa Zone 3 group. He is 34 years old and married, with three children ranging from six months to eight years of age, two of whom are in school. His educational level is six grades of primary school.

Frederic is a farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan  to buy fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor. His business strategy is to utilize better-quality seeds and chemical fertilizers. In the years to come, Frederic would like to become a renowned farmer in his region. With his revenues, he plans to pay for the education and care of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina, es comerciante de ropa y cosméticos, es viuda, tiene un hijo pero no vive con ella, Delfina inicio su negocio hace 4 años, trabaja todos los días de 7:00am a 3:00pm, este negocio le ha dado lo necesario mediante los ingresos para mantenerse.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la reparación de la vivienda como tejas, cemento, hierro, y pago de mano de obra, con esto podrá arreglar el techo de la casa, y tenerla más segura, y vivir más tranquila.
Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio, mantenerse siempre ocupara con trabajo, para poder cubrirse todos sus gastos y necesidades.
texts.en:
Delfina is a clothes and cosmetics merchant.  She's a widow and has a son but he does not live with her.  Delfina started her business four years ago.  She works every day from 7am until 3pm.  Income earned from the business has provided her with the basics.

She's asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies to repair her home like roofing tiles, cement and iron and to pay labor costs.  With this she'll be able to repair her house's roof so that it will be more secure and she can live more care-free.  Her goal is to improve the business and to stay busy with work in order to cover her needs and expenses.

loans.use: to buy roof tiles, cement and iron and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Juan tiene 32 años y es Soltero no tiene hijos, pero con el tiempo desea formar una familia, Juan  tiene la actividad de Servicio de Internet y Llamadas Telefónicas, en una tienda que tiene en una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad de Cochabamba, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, Juan  utilizara este préstamo para la compra de una maquina de computación y mantenimiento de su internet, ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos para mantenerse y también a sus hermanos y Padres  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de mejorar el servicio que ofrece a sus clientes. Juan  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, los problemas sociales y  utilizara los beneficios del crédito en  mejorar su internet,  desea con el tiempo poder tener m as sucursales de su negocio en la ciudad de Cochabamba y también en algunas de sus provincias, se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juan, 32, is single and has no children but in time would like to form a family.  Juan has an Internet access and telephone services business in a store located in a very busy zone in the city of Cochabamba.  

This loan is his first loan sequence in the institution and Juan will use this loan to buy a computer and to provide maintenance to his Internet since this is his only source of income to support himself and his siblings and parents.  

His reason for requesting the loan is because he needs to improve the service he offers his customers.  Juan faces challenges in his business like competition and societal problems and will use the benefits from the loan to improve his Internet.  In time, he’d like to have more branches of his business in the city of Cochabamba and also in some of the provinces.  He feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy a computer and for maintenance of his Internet café.

loans.name: Shallifatu

texts.en: Shallifatu is a single parent with five children. She earns a living as a baker, and we see her here standing in front of the oven she uses for baking. For the last two years, she has also sold maize in the town of Nkromofokrom near Cape Coast. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children. She is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar and cooking oil for her baking business and maize to sell. With her profits, Shallifa will expand her businesses.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil and maize.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa tiene 50 años y es madre soltera de 2 hijos que son de las edades de  32 y 27 años, se dedica a la  elaboración de comida que es chicharrón de carne de cerdo y de pollo, su negocio se encuentra en la zona de Lava Lava,  este préstamo es el primero que ha tomado dentro de la institución, la Sra. Rosa utilizara  este préstamo  para la compra de insumos como carne, aceite, mote pelado,   para la elaboración de sus riquísimo  Chicharrón y así de esta manera incrementar sus ventas y por ende su capital, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para adquirir lo necesario, Rosa enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las altas y bajas de ingresos y  utilizara los beneficios invirtiendo  sigue en la compra de insumos y refrescos, la Sra., Rosa se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Rosa, 50, is a single mother of two children who are 32 and 27 years old.  She makes food: pork chicharrones [fried pork].  Her business is located in the Lava Lava zone.  

This is the first loan she’s taken in the institution and Rosa will use the loan to buy ingredients like meat, oil and hominy to make her very delicious chicharrón so that she can increase sales and thus her capital.  The reason for requesting the loan is that she does not have enough money to buy what’s needed.  

Rosa faces challenges in her business caused by her income’s ups and downs and will use profits to reinvest in the purchase of ingredients and soft-drinks.  Rosa feels very happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make chicharrones.

loans.name: Dorca Group

texts.es:
El grupo Dorca lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Yuridia Jaqueline de 21 años quien se dedica al comercio de ropa, además tiene una fritanga desde hace 1 ½ años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería en ropa.
Ella es casada, tiene dos niños de 4 y 2 años de edad, y su meta es lograr poner su tienda.
Las otras integrantes son Aracely de 28 años quien tiene una fritanga, vende cosméticos y vende postres tradicionales arroz con leche, cajetas…etc. Y Martha Cecilia quien comercializa productos Arabella.
texts.en:
The group Dorca is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial people, one of which is 21 year-old Yuridia Jaqueline. She sells clothing for a living. Additionally she has had a small restaurant for 1 ½ years. She will invest the loan into the purchase of clothing merchandise. She is married, has two children, 2 years old and 4 years old, and her goal is to succeed with her store.
The other members are Aracely  who is 28 years old and has a small restaurant, sells cosmetics and sells traditional desserts like rice pudding, sweets, etc. and Martha Cecilia who sells Arabella products.

loans.use: to purchase clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Emprendedoras lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María Auxiliadora quien es docente desde hace varios años y tiene una modesta escuela de reforzamiento en la materia de inglés dese hace 10 años. También ellas venta de cosméticos negocio que emprendió hace 6 años.
Ella invertirá el crédito en ambos negocios con la compra de inmobiliarios y cosméticos. Su meta es poner una tienda. Con el crédito anterior logro mejorar las condiciones de su escuela.
Las otras integrantes son Yelba se dedica al comercio de ropa, cobertores, zapatos, colcha, bisuteria…etc. Desde hace 16 años  y Manuel es entrenador canino desde hace 20 años y vende loterías desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
The "Emprendedoras"  group has three hardworking, enterprising members.  One of them is María Auxiliadora who has been a teacher for many years and for the last ten years has had a modest school for English learning.  She also started to sell cosmetics six years ago.

She will invest the loan in both businesses buying display cases and cosmetics.  Her goal is to set up a store.  She used the previous loan to improve her school's condition.

The other group members are Yelba who has sold clothes, comforters, shoes, bedspreads, costume jewelry, etc. for the last 16 years and Manuel who has been a dog trainer for 20 years and has sold lottery tickets for the last 10.

loans.use: to buy display cases and cosmetics.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.ru:
Виктор развивает свой бизнес в двух направлениях - растениеводство (выращивание помидор в теплицах) и животноводство. Ферма большая, вложено много средств. В этом году Виктору нужно приобрести зерно для животных, а также нужна пленка для теплиц.

Прошлый кредит Виктор брал на закупку кормов для животных.  Получил хорошую прибыль, смог купить автомобиль, о котором давно мечтал. Недавно пришел из армии младший сын Виктора, сейчас работает вместе с ним, помогает на ферме. 

В этом году Виктор расширяет животноводство. Он хочет построить еще одни сарай на 50 свиней. Всего он может держать до 500 свиней.
texts.en: Viktor develops his business in two directions - farming (growing tomatoes in greenhouses) and animal husbandry.  His farm is large and has a lot of funds invested in it.  This year, Viktor needs to buy grain for the livestock and also needs plastic for greenhouses.  He obtained his previous loan to buy feed for livestock.  He made a good profit, was able to buy a car that he dreamt of for a long time.  Recently, Viktor's youngest son returned from the army and now works with him and helps him on the farm.  This year, Viktor is expanding his animal husbandry business.  He wants to build another barn for 50 pigs.  All together, he is able to keep up to 500 pigs.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and plastic for his greenhouses

loans.name: Las Flores De Yanaconas Group

texts.en:
Eleven enterprising women in the rural community of Urubamba comprise the village bank “Las Flores de Yanaconas.” Urubamba is located in the Sacred Valley high up in the Andean mountains of Cusco, just a few hours from the ancient ruins of Macchu Picchu. Most of the village bank members are engaged in agricultural activities. Some raise small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs. Others have farms where they grow vegetables such as lettuce, carrots, and broccoli.

In the photo, Rosa María appears in the front row on the far right side. Rosa María is 42 years old and lives with her partner, who works as a driver and construction worker. She has three children who are 17, 20 and 24 years old. For ten years, Rosa Maria has been running two primary businesses from her home. One is a small grocery store, which supplies basic necessities including cooking oil, rice, and milk. In addition, Rosa Maria raises chickens in her front yard. 

Rosa Maria is requesting part of the group loan of 9,100 soles in order to purchase more chickens and merchandise for her store. She says that the items that tend to run out most quickly are beer, sugar, milk, and rice. She hopes that all of her children will complete their education. In addition, she aspires to build her credit so that she can request larger loans in the future and continue investing in her businesses.

Two individuals in the photo are not members of the village bank and therefore their faces have been blurred.

loans.use: to buy chickens and grocery merchandise such as beer, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame is married and has three children.  He sells sacks and cutlasess at Nkromfofokrom near Cape Coast, which he has been doing for two years. His wife is a fish monger.  

Kwame is requesting a loan to buy more sacks and cutlasses to sell.  He uses his income to pay his children’s school fees. With the new profit, Kwame hopes to produce the cutlasses and sacks himself.

loans.use: to purchase sacks and cutlasses to sell.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Miguel lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Mercedes de 62 años quien desde muy joven se dedica al comercio de comida con lo cual saco a delante a sus tres hijos que ya son mayores. Ella invertirá el crédito en el negocio de las tortillas y en una cocina industrial.
Las otras integrantes son Ángela de 51 años quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes, cosméticos, ropa y calzado desde hace 15 años y Rosa quien tiene una pulpería.
texts.en: The "San Miguel" group is made up of three hardworking, enterprising women.  One of them is Mercedes, 62, who has been selling food since she was very young and which allowed her to raise her three children who are now adults.  She will use the loan in her tortilla business and to buy an industrial stove.  The other group members are Ángela, 51, who has been selling perfume, cosmetics, clothes and footwear for 15 years and Rosa who owns a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and an industrial stove.

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es:
El grupo Alegría lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosa María quien se dedica a la venta de comida y fresco desde hace 13 años. Ella inicio este negocio con poco y luego fue creciendo, el crédito lo ocupara para comprar granos básicos, carne, pollo, perecederos…etc. 
Las otras integrantes son Nora del se dedica al destace de cerdo desde hace 10 años y produce todo lo derivado (nacatamales, frito, chicharrón, moronga…etc.) y Carolina del Carmen tiene una pulpería desde hace varios años.
texts.en:
The "Alegría" group is made up of three hardoworking, enterprising people.  One of them is Rosa María who has been selling food and refreshments for the last 13 years.  She began the business with very little and has been gradually growing.  She will use  the loan to buy basic grains, meat, chicken, perishables, etc.

The other group members are Nora who has been butchering pigs for 10 years and making derivatives from pork (nacatamales, fried pork, chicharrones, moronga [pork blood sausage], etc. and Carolina del Carmen who has had a grocery store for several years.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, chicken, perishables, etc.

loans.name: Malick

texts.fr:
Notre emprunteur est un habitué du guichet ; il est à son 3ème crédit. Il s’appelle Malick, âgé de 59 ans et père de famille. IL fait de l’aviculture et avec le financement qu’il attend, il va acheter 500 poussins et 3 bouteilles de gaz et aussi leur alimentation jusqu'à  maturité. Il va les élever puis les revendre.
Comme tout bon père de famille, Malick s’occupe de la  dépense quotidienne  de sa famille.
Dans l’avenir, il  aimerait diversifier les produits et services pour maximiser son profil.
texts.en:
Our borrower is a regular client at our branch office. He is on his third loan. His name is Malick, aged 59, and he is a father and a poultry farmer. With the financing he is expecting, he is going to buy 500 chicks and 3 bottles of propane, and also their feed until they are mature. He is going to raise them and then sell them. 

Like all good fathers, Malick takes care of the day-to-day expenses of his family.

In the future, he would like to diversify his products and services in order to maximize his profile.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise and resell

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 30 years old and works in a gold mine, typically starting her day at 8 a.m. and ending between 4 and 5 p.m. She lives with her partner and two children, who are one and seven years old. Felicitas has worked in the gold mine for about one year, and she is requesting a loan in order to purchase a plot of land which she will use to farm potatoes, maize, and beans. With this additional income stream, she hopes to be able to open a store to sell fruit and groceries.

Felicitas is a member of the village bank “Los Caminantes de Ocongate,” which is receiving its first loan from Asociación Arariwa. The group members live in a fairly remote rural community several hours outside of Cusco city, located at an altitude of 3,800 meters up in the Andean mountains.

loans.use: to purchase land for a vegetable farm.

loans.name: Maranata 2 Group

texts.en:
Alida is one of the members of the group Maranata 2, which is made up of five dynamic women who are motivated to work to help their families and community succeed. This group is located in the city of Santo Domingo, a community with few resources located north of the capital of the Dominican Republic. 

Alida is a married woman with four children. She runs a business selling hair, body and cosmetic products.  She has been selling theses products for over 6 years, which has allowed her to start saving. She decided to start her business because her husband's income was not enough for her family's needs.

Alida is receiving her third loan. She is very excited to receive it, and she is ready to have a new source of capital for her businesses. Her plan for the future is to establish her business locally and to open a cosmetics store.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and other items for sale.

loans.name: Yobana Yudy

texts.en:
Yobana is 24 years old and is raising her two children, ages 2 and 5, with her partner. She raises cattle in order to support her family. Her current herd consists of three cows and two bulls. Yobana is requesting a loan in order to purchase cattle feed, such as grass, corn, and barley, in order to fatten her livestock, which she can then sell for a profit. Yobana’s dream is to open a second business selling clothing and to be able to afford a car.

Yobana is a member of the village bank “Los Caminantes de Ocongate,” which is receiving its first loan from Asociación Arariwa. The group members live in a fairly remote rural community several hours outside of Cusco city, located at an altitude of 3,800 meters up in the Andean mountains.

loans.use: to purchase cattle feed such as grass, corn, and barley.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba  is married to a driver, has four children and lives with her family in the town of Amoanda near Cape Coast. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling frozen chicken. She uses her income to help her husband pay their rent and utility bills. She needs this loan to buy larger quantities of frozen chicken to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Araba plans to buy a bigger deep freezer

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of frozen chicken to sell.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana tends to a flock of about 20 sheep and earns a profit by fattening them and later selling them. She is 36 years old and married, with six children between the ages of 1 and 15. She has been raising sheep since she was a teenager, for about 20 years in total. During that time, she has been responsible for ensuring that her sheep are well fed and receive medication when they become sick. Juliana is requesting a loan in order to purchase more sheep. She would like to buy ten more sheep, and her dream is to continue expanding her flock and thereby earn more profits.

Juliana is a member of the village bank “Los Caminantes de Ocongate,” which is receiving its first loan from Asociación Arariwa. The group members live in a fairly remote rural community several hours outside of Cusco city, located at an altitude of 3,800 meters up in the Andean mountains.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Kalbu

texts.ru: Калбу 65 лет, замужем, имеет 5 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Калбу занимается животноводством.  Начатое в 1990 году с 5,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Калбу, ее поголовье насчитывает 1 корову, 1 теленка, 1 нетель, 2 лошади и 30 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Калбу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Калбу планирует вложить в реконструкцию дома, а в дальнейшем - в увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Kalbu is 65 years old, married and has five children.  She is involved in animal husbandry to provide a source of income for her family.  The business, started in 1990 with 5,000 som (KGS), today yields about 12,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products.  Thanks to Kalbu's persistent work, her livestock headcount includes one cow, one calf, two horses and thirty sheep.  In order to further develop her business, Kalbu requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings into remodeling her house and increasing livestock headcount in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva and her husband own a carpentry workshop, where they produce wooden furniture, doors, and windows, mostly for construction projects. While her husband handles the heavy machinery, Primitiva helps with finishing activities such as sanding, lacquering, and painting. The couple have developed their business over the past 15 years, and together they are raising six children between the ages of 8 and 26. Primitiva is requesting a loan in order to purchase wood for the carpentry business. She hopes that she will be able to reinvest her profits in additional equipment such as a band saw. 

Primitiva is a member of the village bank “Los Caminantes de Ocongate,” which is receiving its first loan from Asociación Arariwa. The group members live in a fairly remote rural community several hours outside of Cusco city, located at an altitude of 3,800 meters up in the Andean mountains.

loans.use: to buy wood for a carpentry business.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
En el municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, María Cristina  es una mujer  dedicada a su  labor  diaria como maestra de primaria,   profesión que le gusta mucho desempeñar,  trabajando  con niños de esta comunidad,  compartiendo sus conocimientos, ella  es madre de un niño el cual esta bajo su cargo, sus deseos como el de todo padre responsable, es brindar una mejor condición de vida  a su familia. 

 En segunda ocasión se presenta a Ceprodel con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda,  Es con ese  fin de solicitar un  crédito, para la compra de  Cemento, Arena y Ladrillo,  esto le servirá de mucho beneficio para poder  mejorar  su casa, brindando así un techo seguro. Confía en la institución que puedan otorgárselo y así lograr su meta.
texts.en:
In the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón, María Cristina is a dedicated woman who works as an elementary school teacher, a profession that she greatly enjoys pursuing. She works with the children in this community, sharing her knowledge with them. María Cristina is the mother of a son who is under her care. Like any responsible parent, she desires to provide better living conditions for her family.

She took a second opportunity to approach CEPRODEL about improvements to her home. María Cristina requested a loan to buy cement, sand, and bricks, which will be a great benefit as she makes improvements to her house by installing a secure roof. She trusts that CEPRODEL will provide her with what she needs so that she can attain her goal.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Del Ocote Group

texts.es:
Sulmy  Suyapa, tiene 40 años de edad, es casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 3 hijos los cuales estudian y vive en Aldea el ocote Olanchito. 
Doña Sulmy, hace diez años estableció su propio negocio de venta de ropa nueva como ser pantalones, camisas, blusas y ropa interior para damas y caballeros, el cual lo inicio con sus propios esfuerzos y le dedica diez horas diariamente.
Ella ha mantenido este negocio con la ayuda de los prestamos, lo que ha permitido mejorar su calidad de vida, a la fecha lleva solicitado aproximadamente 22 prestamos. 
Actualmente solicita 25,000.00 Lempiras para surtir el negocio de mercadería como ropa para damas y caballeros.
Su meta es mantener surtido el negocio y establecerlo en un local fijo, también en un futuro desea comprar ganado para tener otros ingresos.

Doña Sulmy (de blusa Blanca)  pertenece al grupo solidario El Esfuerzo del Ocote, junto con doña Nely (blusa rayado), quien también vive en la misma comunidad y se dedica al comercio. También solicita 25,000.00 Lempiras para surtir más su negocio.
texts.en:
Sulmy Suyapa, 40, is married and her husband’s a farmer; she has three children attending school and she lives in the village of El Ocote, Olanchito.

Sulmy started her own clothing sales business ten years ago; she sells pants, blouses, shirts and underwear for ladies and gentlemen.  She started it with her own efforts and works ten hours daily.

She has kept the business going with help from loans that have made it possible for her to improve her quality of life.  To date, she’s requested approximately 22 loans.

She is currently asking for 25,000.00 Lempiras to stock her business with merchandise like women’s and men’s clothes.  Her goal is to keep the business well stocked and to set it up in a fixed locale.  In future, she’d also like to buy cattle to have another source of income.

Sulmy (in the white blouse) belongs to the “El Esfuerzo del Ocote” communal bank together with Nely (striped blouse) who lives in the same community and is a merchant.  She’s also asking for 25,000.00 Lempiras to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to stock her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a fishmonger: she sells smoked fish at Nkramfokron near Cape Coast.  She has done this for some years now. Garace is married with 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay for their accommodation. Grace will use her loan to purchase more smoked fish to sell.  With the new profit, Grace wishes to smoke the fish she sells herself.

loans.use: loan to purchase more smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Wipalitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WIPALITAS” iniciará el ciclo número dos en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora  Mari del Rosario.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Artesanos en alfombras. Costura de ropa miniatura, ayudante de minibús, venta de CD’s, costura de pantalones, costura de mandiles, tejido de mantas, confección de polleras.

La señora María del Carmen hace  dos ciclos que trabaja en una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, en la actualidad ella tiene como negocio la elaboración de artesanías en tela, que desarrolla hace años atrás. El crédito que ahora sacará es para el incremento de capital (compra de tela) misma que adquiere de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias. 

Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo.
texts.en:
The “Wipalitas” communal bank will start cycle #2 in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Focal Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board headed by María del Rosario.  The members carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them are: rug weavers, miniature clothes making, minibus assistant, CD sales, pants making, apron making, blanket weaving and t-shirt making.

María del Carmen has been working in one of Pro Mujer’s communal banks for two cycles.  At present, her business is making fabric crafts; she’s been doing this for years.  The loan she’ll take out now is to increase working capital.  She will buy fabric in the city of El Alto and once she completes production will sell it in street markets.  This way of working allows her to support her family since she’s single and has a son.  When she’s asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes everything.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a petty trader; she sells saucepans, braziers, and other items, which she has done for 4 years now. Aba lives together with her husband, who is a farmer, and 5 dependents. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family. Aba will use her loan to purchase more saucepans and braziers for sale. With the new profit, Aba will expand her business

loans.use: to purchase more saucepans and braziers for sale

loans.name: Grimaldo

texts.en:
Grimaldo is 21 years old and lives with his partner. For about three years, he has held a job operating heavy machinery at a gold mine. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase a plot of land where he can build a house. Little by little, he hopes to build up a business of his own. One day, he would like to own a tourism agency in Cusco.

Grimaldo is a member of the village bank “Los Caminantes de Ocongate,” which is receiving its first loan from Asociación Arariwa. The group members live in a fairly remote rural community several hours outside of Cusco city, located at an altitude of 3,800 meters up in the Andean mountains.

loans.use: to buy land where he can build a house.

loans.name: Myskal

texts.ru: Мыскал 64 года, замужем. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Мыскал занимается животноводством.  Начатое в 2007 году с 50,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 3,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Мыскал, ее поголовье насчитывает 1 корову, 1 лошадь и 10 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мыскал обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Мыскал планирует вложить в расширение бизнес – деятельности посредством посадки картофеля.
texts.en: Myskal is 64 years old and married.  She is involved in animal husbandry to provide a source of income for her family.  The business, started in 2007 with 50,000 som (KGS), today yields about 3,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and meat products.  Thanks to Myskal's persistent work, her livestock headcount includes one cow, one horse and ten sheep.  In order to further develop her business, Myskal requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings into expanding her business by planting potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is 18 years old and works as a cook in a restaurant. The restaurant serves breakfast, a set lunch menu (typically soup and a main course), and dinner. Saida says that the most popular dish is steak with eggs and fries. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a plot of land where she can build a house. By continuing to support herself, she hopes that she can attend university and become a professional.

Saida is a member of the village bank “Los Caminantes de Ocongate,” which is receiving its first loan from Asociación Arariwa. The group members live in a fairly remote rural community several hours outside of Cusco city, located at an altitude of 3,800 meters up in the Andean mountains.

loans.use: to buy land to build a house.

loans.name: Aniceto

texts.en:
Aniceto is 50 years old and married with three children, a 15-year-old daughter and two sons who are 8 and 13 years old. Aniceto raises livestock for meat and milk. His current herd consists of five cattle and one calf. He has developed his business over about six years and is requesting a loan in order to buy more cows. He estimates that a young calf costs 700 to 800 soles (about $250 USD) to acquire. His dream is to continue expanding his herd, as well as to purchase lambs that he can fatten and sell at the market.

Aniceto is a member of the village bank “Sr. de Ccoylloritty de Ocongate,” which is receiving its eighth loan from Asociación Arariwa. The group members live in a fairly remote rural community several hours outside of Cusco city, located at an altitude of 3,800 meters up in the Andean mountains.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon dedicates himself to two primary economic activities: agriculture and construction. In addition to cultivating fields of potatoes, Ramon has worked as a construction worker for about 20 years. Ramon is 34 years old and married with three children who are 11, 12, and 14 years old. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase cows, which he plans to fatten over one to two months then sell at a profit. He dreams of building a successful business raising cattle and thereby provide his family with another income stream.

Ramon is a member of the village bank “Sr. de Ccoylloritty de Ocongate,” which is receiving its eighth loan from Asociación Arariwa. The group members live in a fairly remote rural community several hours outside of Cusco city, located at an altitude of 3,800 meters up in the Andean mountains.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Isaias

texts.en:
Isaias is 25 years old and works as a driver for a company that provides transportation services in a gold mining zone. He lives with his partner and is raising a 9-month-old son. He works about 10 hours a day between midnight and mid-day. Isaias is requesting a loan in order to obtain a commercial driver’s license. His dream is to work for a large company, and to one day purchase his own vehicle.

Isaias is a member of the village bank “Sr. de Ccoylloritty de Ocongate” which is receiving its eighth loan from Asociación Arariwa. The group members live in a fairly remote rural community several hours outside of Cusco city, located at an altitude of 3,800 meters up in the Andean mountains.

loans.use: to obtain a commercial driver's license.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.en:
Juan Bautista and his wife own a carpentry workshop, where they produce wooden furniture, doors, and windows, mostly for construction projects. While Juan Bautista handles the heavy machinery, his wife helps with finishing activities such as sanding, lacquering, and painting. The couple have developed their business over the past 15 years, and together are raising six children between the ages of 8 and 26. Juan Bautista  is requesting a loan in order to purchase wood for the carpentry business. He hopes that he will be able to reinvest his profits in additional equipment such as a band saw. 

Juan Bautista is a member of the village bank “Los Caminantes de Ocongate,” which is receiving its first loan from Asociación Arariwa. The group members live in a fairly remote rural community several hours outside of Cusco city, located at an altitude of 3,800 meters up in the Andean mountains.

loans.use: to buy wood for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a young client, 28 years old, married and has one child.

Since 2008, Ahmad has been an owner of a shop selling construction materials.   He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and his shop is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan of $3000 to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family. Because he is under 30, Ahmad qualifies for a "youth loan".

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his construction shop.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, tiene ingresos de la renta que recibe cada mes y también se dedica al comercio junto a su esposa.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de cemento, arena y piedra para la construcción de un garaje en su casa para brindar más comodidad a su familia, pues actualmente la movilidad que tiene la parquea en la calle y es muy peligroso.
Pedro, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos con los cuales vive en casa propia en la zona Las Lomas ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en: Pedro earns income from rent he receives monthly and also works as a merchant together with his wife.  He needs the loan to build a garage at his house to provide more comfort for his family because he currently parks his car in the street and that's very dangerous.  Pedro is married and has four children he lives with in his own house located in the city of La Paz's Las Lomas zone.  This is the second time he works with IMPRO and the first with KIVA.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and rocks to build a garage in his home

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia  residente en el municipio de Galapa, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla,  es una mujer casada que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 20 a 22 años. Ella es una incansable trabajadora que se dedica a una actividad comercial, a través de la cual  ofrece sus productos mediante guías especializadas o catálogos; así mismo compra independientemente mercancías que no trae su guía, y como ingreso complementario,  también vende verduras.  Se dedica a la actividad comercial desde hace 8 años aproximadamente; con esta labor ayuda en gran parte a los gastos del hogar y se siente muy feliz de poder hacerlo. Sus ventas mensuales le generan un buen margen de rentabilidad, lo que le  permite aportar a los egresos de su familia y cubrir sus gastos personales, Su esposo tiene una motocicleta en la que ofrece el servicio de transporte, que también genera ingresos. Patricia maneja un margen de rentabilidad acorde al tipo de negocio que opera, mientras su cartera rota ágilmente. Últimamente su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responder a la creciente demanda que tiene;  esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  productos por catalogo como colonias, mascarillas, bases faciales, cremas, gel, delineador, desodorantes, productos que tiene encargados, aprovechando las ofertas que vienen en cada campaña de ventas; también invertirá en su negocio de verduras,comprando este producto que le genera buenos ingresos.   Su inversión supone él éxito, porque aplicaría los descuentos a su precio de ventas y con ellos continuaría su proceso de aumentar y fidelizar el número de clientes.
texts.en:
Patricia lives in the town of Galapa, 20 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  She’s a married woman who has three children whose ages range from 20 to 22 years.  She is a tireless worker engaged in a commercial activity through which she sells products via specialized guidebooks or catalogues.  She also buys items independently that are not included in the catalogues and as an additional source of income also sells vegetables.

She’s been in this commercial activity for about 8 years and through this labor is able to help out with a large part of household expenses and she feels very happy to be able to do so.  Her monthly sales generate a good profit margin which allows her to contribute to family spending and cover her personal expenses.  Her husband has a motorcycle that he provides transportation services with and also generates income.

Patricia’s profit margin is in line with the type of business she operates and her stock rotates quickly.  Lately, her working capital is insufficient to meet growing customer demand and this is why she’s calling upon a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she’ll use to buy catalogue items like cologne, face masks, make-up foundation, creams, gels, eyeliner, deodorants and products she has pending orders for taking advantage of sales specials.  She will also invest in her vegetable business buying products that generate good income.  Her investment augurs success because she will apply the discounts to her sales prices thus continuing the process of increasing the number of her regular customers.

loans.use: to buy catalogue cosmetics and vegetables.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana, estudia Veterinaria en la universidad, ella  obtiene ingresos de forma independiente ya que viaja a los pueblos a vacunar a los animales y de esta forma pagar sus estudios.
El crédito lo requiere para tramitar su titulo de bachiller y culminar cursos superiores para obtener mas ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
Liliana, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona Tembladerani ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Liliana is studying Veterinary Scienceds at the university.  She earns income independently because she travels to towns to vaccinate animals and this is how she pays for her schooling.  She needs the loan to pay fees to register her Bachelor's Degree and to complete higher education courses to obtain more income and help her family.  Liliana is single and has no children.  She lives in her parents' house in the city of La Paz's Tembladerani zone.  It's the first time she's worked with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to pay fees to register her diploma at the Ministry of Education.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro, trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada de seguros en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para terminar sus estudios superiores en contabilidad y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos para mantener a su hijo.
Ramiro, es soltero y tiene un hijo con el cual vive en una casa alquilada en la zona Villa Fátima de la cuidad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Ramiro works as an employee in a private insurance company in the city of La Paz.  He needs the loan to finish his higher education courses in Accounting so that he can improve his income to support his son.  Ramiro is single and has a son he lives with in a rented house in the city of La Paz's Villa Fátima sector.  This is the first time he's worked with IMPRO and first time with KIVA too.

loans.use: to complete his accounting courses.

loans.name: Dante

texts.es:
Dante, trabaja como consultor  y supervisor de un restaurante  ya que tiene un contrato en la ciudad de Santa Cruz. 
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una cocina, un refrigerador y cubrir el costo dela instalación de su propio restaurante para tener más ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Dante, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Dante works as a consultant and restaurant manager since he has a contract with the city of Santa Cruz.  He needs the loan to set up his own restaurant to earn income to help his family.  Dante is single and has no children.  He lives in his parents' house in the city of La Paz's Irpavi zone.  It's the third time he's worked with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to purchase a stove, a refrigerator, and the cost of installation to open his own restaurant

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua lives together with her husband, who is a farmer, and 5 dependents. Ekua sells cloth, she has been selling cloth for 2 years now. Ekua uses her income to assist the husband to pay their utility bills.  Ekua will use her loan to purchase more cloth to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.es:
Sarah, trabaja independientemente ya que es Psicóloga, también recibe ingresos de su ex esposo para mantener a sus hijos.
El crédito lo requiere para terminar sus estudios superiores y de esta forma obtener mejores ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Sarah, es divorciada y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Sarah works independently as a psychologist. She also receives income from her ex-husband in order to support her children. The loan she is requesting will be used to finish her higher education so that she can earn more income for supporting her family. Sarah is divorced and has two children. They live at her parents' house in the District of Obrajes in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the cost of finishing her higher education in psychology.

loans.name: Julian

texts.en:
Julian is 45 years old and has been raising cattle and sheep for the past 17 years. He purchases the animals when they are small and skinny and fattens them so he can sell them for a profit. In addition, he sells the milk that his cows produce. Julian is receiving his first loan from Asociación Arariwa and is grateful for the opportunity to improve his business. He is requesting the loan in order to purchase more cows. He is married and has four children between the ages of 21 and 25, all of whom are living independently.

Julian recently joined the village bank “Sr. de Ccoylloritty de Ocongate,” which is receiving its eighth loan from Asociación Arariwa. The group members live in a fairly remote rural community several hours outside of Cusco city, located at an altitude of 3,800 meters up in the Andean mountains.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.en:
Jose Luis is 26 years old and operates a front-end loader at a gold mine. He has held this position for two years. Jose Luis is requesting a loan in order to purchase land so that he can build a house. He hopes to continue working with heavy machinery and to obtain certificates that will allow him to operate other types of equipment at the mines.

Jose Luis is a member of the village bank “Sr. de Ccoylloritty de Ocongate,” which is receiving its eighth loan from Asociación Arariwa. The group members live in a fairly remote rural community several hours outside of Cusco city, located at an altitude of 3,800 meters up in the Andean mountains.

loans.use: to buy land for a house.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 57 years old, divorced and has one child.

Zahra is a tailor since 1998; she makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally as suits, coats and dresses for women. She has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is being well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for $1800 loan in order to purchase tailoring machine and to add more goods. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and to add more goods.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo is 39 years old and lives with his partner and two sons, who are 12 and 14 years old. He has been a construction worker for ten years, mostly working as a contractor on all types of structural projects. Depending on his project, he typically works almost every day of the week from 7am to 5-6 pm. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase construction tools, such as a concrete mixer and a winch, which is a tool used to adjust the tension of a rope or cable. Gerardo dreams of opening a hardware shop one day, as well as owning a car.

Gerardo is a member of the village bank “Sr. de Ccoylloritty de Ocongate,” which is receiving its eighth loan from Asociación Arariwa. The group members live in a fairly remote rural community several hours outside of Cusco city, located at an altitude of 3,800 meters up in the Andean mountains.

loans.use: to buy construction tools such as a concrete mixer and winch.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 42-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 7 years to 17 years. He describes himself to be visionary and creative. He operates a butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for seven months and employs two staff members. His business is located at an ideal and viable place for the business, and his primary customers are men and women. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more meat. Peter's dream and business goal is to run another butcher shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more meat for selling

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en:
Valentin is 25 years old and raising a son of 1 year and 9 months with his partner. He has held a job as a construction worker for the past two years, mostly working as a contractor on housing projects. He is requesting the loan in order to help his nephew buy land so he can build a house. Valentin’s dream for the future is to be able to live independently and adequately support his family.

Valentin is a member of the village bank “Sr. de Ccoylloritty de Ocongate,” which is receiving its eighth loan from Asociación Arariwa. The group members live in a fairly remote rural community several hours outside of Cusco city, located at an altitude of 3,800 meters up in the Andean mountains.

loans.use: to buy land for a house.

loans.name: Camilo

texts.en:
