Luci como de cariño le dicen está casada con Antonio  y tienen cinco hijos de nombres Alexis, Marco Antonio, Mercedes, Edgar y Diana los dos últimos estudian la secundaria, y el menor Alexis el cual estudia primaria. 

Ella se dedica a vender fruta de temporada que ella cultiva y hace vestimentas de la cultura mazahua las cuales las vende en su comunidad desde hace más de 20 años. Platica que está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de abonos orgánicos y para insecticidas ya que tiene varios árboles de aguacate, de durazno, guayabas, andrinas y chiles manzanos también abeces cultiva rábanos y jitomates en su casa ya que tiene un terreno muy amplio y cuando es temporada de cosecha dice que vende sus frutos y legumbres en la central de abastos de una poblacion cerca a su comunidad. Dice que con ese negocio lleva un poco mas de 5 años y que fue muy bueno en emprenderlo ya que le deja muy buenas ganancias y así puede darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y así le puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella está muy contenta porque se ha superado atravez de los créditos y poco a poco está haciendo su sueño realidad tener su huerto en buenas condiciones. Una de sus metas es comprar un vehículo donde se le facilite el transporte de sus frutas y legumbres ya que paga flete para transportar lo que cultiva. 

Los otros 3 integrantes del grupo se llaman Gonzalo, Jose Juan y Aucencio los cuales invertirán en su créditos en frutas y legumbres de temporada y abarrotes.
texts.en:
Lucila is 38 years old and is part of the "El Rincon" group. The Mazahua culture still predominates in this community, where the women wear Mazahua traditional clothing and speak Mazahua. Luci, as her friends and family call her,, is married to Antonio, and they have five children, named Alexis, Marco Antonio, Mercedes, Edgar, and Diana. The last two are in secondary school, and the youngest, Alexis, is in primary school. 

Luci sells seasonal fruits that she grows, and she makes typical clothing of the Mazahua culture, which she has been selling in her community for more than 20 years. She says that she is applying for a loan for the purchase of organic fertilizers and for insecticides, since she has a number of avocado, peach, guava, and black cherry trees. She also sometimes grows manzano chile peppers, radishes, and tomatoes at her house, since she has ample land, and when it is the harvest season she says that she sells her fruits and vegetables in a central area in her community. She says that she has been in this business a little more than 5 years and that she did well when she set it up, since it gives her good earnings and thus she can give her children a better quality of life and help her husband with the household expenses. She is very happy because through the loans she has set her sights every higher, and little by little she is making her dream -- to have an orchard in good condition -- a reality. One of her goals is to buy a vehicle, which will facilitate the transport of her fruits and vegetables, since she pays freight charges to transport what she grows. 

The other three members of the group are Gonzalo, Jose Juan, and Aucencio, who will invest their loans in seasonal fruits and vegetables and groceries.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and insecticides, since she has a number of avocado, peach, guava, and black cherry trees, as well as manzano chile peppers, radishes, and tomatoes

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efrain tiene 41 años de edad, está casado, tiene  5 hijos de 7,13,16, 20 y 24 años de edad, dos de ellos están estudiando, vive con su familia en Intibucá.
Efrain, es muy trabajador, tiene su propio negocio, desde hace diez años se dedica a la ebanistería, donde hace todo tipo de muebles como puertas, mesas, sillas, roperos, ventanas, etc. el trabaja todo el día en esta actividad y le gusta mucho este oficio. 
Inicio con esfuerzos propios, poco a poco ha hecho crecer el negocio, y con la ayuda de los préstamos ha podido comprar maquinaria y herramientas necesarias.
Actualmente está solicitando el tercer préstamo de 3,000.00 Lempiras para comprar  madera para elaborar muebles. 
Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio y con las utilidades ayudar a sus hijos con la educación.
texts.en:
Efrain, age 41, is married and has five children, ages 7, 13, 16, 20, and 24.  Two of them are in school.  He lives with his family in Intibucá.

Efrain is a very hard-worker, and he has his own business.  He has devoted himself to cabinetmaking for ten years.  He makes all types of furniture like doors, tables, chairs, wardrobes, and windows, etc.  He works all day at this business activity, and he likes this trade very much.

He started with his own efforts.  Little by little he has made his business grow.  With the help of the loans he has been able to buy machinery and needed tools.

He is currently requesting his third loan for 3,000 lempiras to buy wood to make furniture.

His goal is to make his business grow and to use the profits to help with his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin, a Florida native, has always had a strong urge to help the community around him. After spending many years in the corporate world, he noticed a need for professional counseling in the young professionals around him. He saw the potential that many of his co-workers were capable of reaching, and recognized that they needed encouragement and guidance to reach it. Bearing this in mind, Kevin started his own business in 2012 in order to help people in need of professional education and counseling.
Through his business, U-Strive Coaching, Kevin aims to develop young students and professionals to their full potential. Along with professional counseling, Kevin also offers personal counseling to “help people gain more clarity in life," a pursuit that has become very important to him. 
Kevin hopes to make U-Strive Coaching a household name synonymous with personal development and professional success. Kevin needs this loan to purchase new materials so that he can expand the services he offers. Additionally, the loan will help Kevin fund new marketing tactics to further grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase new materials such as books and cameras, as well as new marketing materials.

loans.name: Tynisha

texts.en: Tynisha has been operating a property management company for over two years and just transformed it into her own fully-functioning limited liability company. She works as a property manager for several different property owners, making the link between qualified tenants and a rental agreement. She provides the service of screening the applicant and recommending them for a fitting property if they qualify. In addition to this, she is the point of contact, in place of the property owners, for the tenants to contact with any problems. She is applying for this loan to expand her marketing and her home office to grow her business. She would also like this loan to double as a working credit line for her business.

loans.use: to increase marketing efforts and expand her home office.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 33 years old and married with two children. With her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

For the past eight years Analyn has run a sari-sari, or general store. She sells a variety of items such as sugar, cream, milk, snack foods, sardines, etc. in her shop.

Analyn has requested a 30,000 PHP loan from NWTF in order to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari. She would like to earn money to cover school fees so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 44 years old.  She is married and has two children, one of whom attends school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Emelia has a fishing business in the Philippines.  Emelia has requested a loan in the amount of 23,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.  Emelia has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Emelia would like to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier es un joven de 30 años de edad que vie con su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad  en un municipio ubicado  a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla; allí tiene una microempresa   donde presta el servicio de llamadas, recargas y venta de sim cards, también comercializa morrales y productos de confitería; él y su esposa trabajan juntos  generando  ingresos para   cubrir todos los gastos familiares. Su negocio tiene 4 años de estar funcionando, después de quedar desempleado. Javier desea incrementar el surtido de su oferta e incluir en este negocio equipos Celulares y otras mercancías, pero ante la creciente demanda su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente para responder a esté propósito. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará   teléfonos celulares y   productos de papelería. Su meta mas adelante es agregar una sala de internet. Mientras se esmera  en trabajar su negocio maneja una rentabilidad no menor del 27,50% , desde la cual planea  su crecimiento con su nueva inversión.
texts.en:
Javier is a young man who is 30 years of age and lives with his wife and five-year-old son in a town located 10 minutes from the city of Barranquilla. There he has a small enterprise where he provides calling services, sells and reloads SIM cards, and offers backpacks and candy. He and his wife work together in order to generate income to cover all of their family expenses. His business was started four years ago after he became unemployed. Javier wants to increase the stock of products that he offers and include cellular phone equipment and other merchandise. Prior to experiencing growth in demand, his operating capital was insufficient for being able to respond to this situation. For this reason he is requesting a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

Javier will use the money to buy cellular phones and stationery products. His goal moving forward is to add an Internet café. In the meantime, he manages to maintain a profitability rate of no less than 27.5%. This signals the growth from his new investment.

loans.use: to buy cellular phones and stationery products.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is a 32-year-old businesswoman who wants to make progress in her business. She is married and has three school-aged children.  Her family lives happily in the village of La Salette Province of Isabela.  

Dominga makes a living by raising hogs.  She has one mother pig and piglets that she raises in her backyard.  The income from selling some of her hogs helped Dominga open a variety store that provides a daily net income of 300 PHP.  Dominga hopes to have additional capital to improve her new business and maintain her hog-raising business.  

Dominga is requesting to a loan of 15,000 PHP for the maintenance of her hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets for her business

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 54-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.   Ana has a business selling fish in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 15 years.

Ana requested a PHP 21,000 loan through Kiva partner Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell at her food stall.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a business selling food in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from a variety store.

Epefania requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Kiva partner Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more ingredients for her food production business.  In the future, Epefania would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajando Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Mujeres trabajando esta conformado por trece mujeres trabajadoras que se dedican a la venta y elaboración de ropa típica.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Honoria una señora de sesenta y siete años de edad.
Ella se caracteriza como una señora trabajadora y alegre que desde pequeña a trabajado y a sabido como  cuesta llevarse el pan a la boca.
Ella se dedica a la venta de   dulces desde el más barato como el más caro se va a las fiestas de su localidad par que sus paisanos le compren sus dulces.
Ella nos cuenta que le gusta mucho vender sus dulces por que le deja buenas ganancias y desde hace diez años se ha dedicado a ala venta de dulces.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de más dulces e hilos y manta para la elaboración de ropa típica ya que le gusta mucho tejer pero lo que mas le gusta y es su vida es la venta de dulces ya que le agrada mucho vender sus dulces por las calles de su comunidad.
 Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Sofía-se dedica a la venta de ropa típica.
Francisca Felisa  - se dedica a la venta de ropa típica.
Alba-se dedica a la venta de ropa típica.
Aloína- se dedica a la venta de ropa típica.
Sebastiana Hermila-se dedica a la venta de típica.
Victoria Maria- se dedica a la venta de ropa típica.
Emilia-se dedica a la venta de ropa típica.
Catalina- se dedica a la venta de ropa típica.
Sofía Honoria - se dedica a la venta de ropa típica.
Dominga – se dedica a la venta de ropa típica.
Julia Lucia - se dedica a la venta de ropa típica.
Gabriela- se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y ropa típica. 

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo que les da a las mujeres trabajadoras que desean mejorar su vidas y de su familia y vestir a sus paisanos por trajes típicos y ellos por manos mexicanas.
texts.en:
This group is called Mujeres Trabajando and is made up of thirteen hardworking women who work selling and making traditional clothing.  One of the members of this group is Honoria, a 66-year-old woman.  She is a hardworking and happy woman who has worked since she was little and has learned how difficult it is to have food to eat.

She works selling sweets, from the cheapest to the most expensive.  She goes to parties in her community so her fellow community members can buy sweets from her.  She tells us that she likes selling her sweets a lot because it gives her good profits.  She has worked selling sweets for ten years.

She requested the loan to buy more candy, and thread and fabric to make traditional clothing.  She very much likes to weave but what she most likes, and it is her life, is selling candy because it pleases her a lot to sell her candy in the streets of her community.

The other members of the group are Sofía, Francisca Felisa, Alba, Eloína, Sebastiana Hermila, Victoria María, Emilia, Catalina, Sofía Honoria, Dominga, and Julia Lucía, who sell traditional clothing; and Gabriela, who sells groceries and traditional clothing.  They are grateful to the foundation for the support it gives to hardworking women who want to improve their lives and those of their families, and to dress themselves and their compatriots in traditional outfits with Mexican labor.

loans.use: to buy sweets, and thread and fabric to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: La Cabañita Group

texts.es:
Doña Consuelo tiene 53 años de edad ella es parte del grupo La Cabañita dice que le pusieron ese nombre a su grupo porque donde hacían sus reuniones era en una cabaña de una de las integrantes y es por eso que le pusieron así. Consuelo tiene un taller de serigrafía desde hace mas de 10 años ahí hace calendarios, agendas, hace carteles, mandan hacer tesis para las personas que se titulan, mandan imprimir playeras, tasas con decorados favoritos de los clientes, también platica que hacen invitaciones para fiestas, folletos etc. Dice que su negocio lo emprendió por que su esposo fue que le enseño a ella a manejar las maquinas para hacer letras, dibujos, bordados etc. Donde tiene su negocio renta ya que en su casa no tiene espacio suficiente para las maquinas, dice que está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de tinta, papel, bolsas, calendarios y para darle mantenimiento a las maquinas, dice que le servirá de mucho el crédito por que en estos meses tienen trabajo debido a que le mandan hacer tesis y podrán tener material para hacerlas. 

Ella está casada con el señor Raúl ellos ya no tienen hijos que dependen de ellos ya que todos son mayores de edad. La meta que tiene Consuelo es poder hacer un local en su casa para ya no pagar rentas ya que sale muy caro y tienen perdidas de ganancias. 

Las otras trece personas integrantes del grupo se llaman Leticia, Ma. del Rosario, Florentina, Maribel, Tomasa, Blanca Estela, Maricela, Martha, Isabel, Liliana, Reynalda, Sofía, Alejandra ellas invertirán en una tienda de abarrotes, en material para hacer costuras artesanales, frutas y legumbres de temporada, compra de insumos para hacer pan, bisutería, herramientas para taller mecánico, en una pollería y en la compra de zapatos y ropa por catalogo todo para su venta.
texts.en:
Doña Consuelo, 53, belongs to the communal bank "La Cabañita" (The Little Cabin).  The name of the group comes from the fact that its meetings used to be held in a cabin belonging to one of the members.  Consuelo has a silk screen printing workshop which she has been running for ten years.  She makes calendars, agendas, posters, and prints thesis papers, t-shirts or mugs.  She also prints party invitations, brochures, etc.  She claims the business was started by her husband who taughter her how to use the machines to make letters, drawings, embroidery designs, etc.  She rents space for her shop since she does not have room at home for the machines.  The loan she is requesting is to buy ink, paper, bags, calendars and to pay for machine maintenance.  The loan will be very helpful because she has many thesis-printing orders this time of the year and she will be able to obtain the materials she needs for this.

She is married to Raúl and their adult children live independently.  Consuelo's goal is to open a shop in her house so she does not have to pay rent which is expensive and cuts into her profit.

The other 13 members of the group are Leticia, Maria del Rosario, Florentina, Maribel, Tomasa, Blanca Estela, Maricela, Martha, Isabel, Liliana, Reynalda, Sofía, and Alejandra.  They will be investing in a grocery store, fabric for sewing crafts, seasonal fruit and vegetable sales, ingredients to make bread, costume jewelry sales, mechanical workshop tools, chicken sales, and catalogue clothing and shoe sales.

loans.use: To buy ink, paper, bags, calendars, and to provide maintenance for silk screen printing machines.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 35 years old and married.  She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines.   Mary Ann has run the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport and farming sugarcane.

Mary Ann requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Kiva partner Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more items to sell at her store.  Prior to this loan, she has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF.  Mary Ann aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 33 years old.  She is married and has three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Evangeline is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from selling food.

Evangeline is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ninosca

texts.es: La señora Ninosca es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien es docente desde hace 8 años, según expreso es una profesión muy bonita y que requiere de vocación. El crédito que solicita es de uso personal el cual ocupara para realizarse un chequeo médico y comprar ciertas cosas.
texts.en:
Sra. Ninosca is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has been a teacher for eight years. According to her, she says teaching is a very nice profession and a vocation that requires much from her.

The loan she is requesting is for personal use. It will be used to obtain a medical checkup and to pay for certain items.

loans.use: to pay for a medical checkup and other items.

loans.name: Jannet

texts.en:
Jannet is 35 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for her family.  Jannet runs a variety store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 5 years.  She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, and other groceries. 

Jannet requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Kiva partner Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more products to sell.  In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell at her variety store.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 28 years old and married with two children.  She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines.  Jessica has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Jessica requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Kiva partner Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy more items to sell in her store.  Prior to this loan, she has borrowed and repaid from other loans from NWTF.   Jessica aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Blanca Isabel

texts.es:
Blanca, vive con su esposo, tiene dos hijos pero ya están casados, ella se dedica a la venta de semilla de marañón, esta venta la inicio como una fuente generadora de dinero, para poder solventar algunas necesidades del hogar, la realiza junto a su esposo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de semilla cruda, esta la venden para ser procesada y puesta a la venta, este préstamo le ayudara para que Blanca tenga de este fruto para seguir procesándola y en la venta.
La aspiración de ella es que a través de su esfuerzo y trabajo pueda mejorar las instalaciones de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca lives with her husband. She has two children, but they are already married. Blanca sells cashew nuts. She started this business as a way of generating income to cover some of her household needs. Blanca performs the work with her husband.

She is requesting a loan to buy raw cashew nuts that will be processed and sold from her vending post. This loan will help Blanca have the inventory required to continue processing and acquire finished products to sell. Her aspiration is to strive and work toward making improvements to the facilities in her home.

loans.use: to buy raw cashew nuts.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is from the village of Saranay, Cabatuan.  She is 27 years old and married with two children. She has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for almost three years and earns approximately PHP 250 daily. Through the income generated from her business, Angel has been able to give daily allowances to her children for school.  

Angel requests a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase grocery items, such as canned goods, assorted biscuits, and basic kitchen items, to sell.  She hopes that she will receive the loan because it will allow her to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, such as canned goods, assorted biscuits, and basic kitchen items, to sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena is from Balili, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. She is 57 years old, widowed, and has four children. Nena owns and operates a business making and selling banana cue food (snack food). She has been in her business for four years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Nena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nena is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to buy more bananas in order to sell more. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas

loans.name: Febe

texts.en:
Febe is 61 years old and married with 7 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Febe runs a boutique in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell. Febe has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as blouses, shirts, and pants.

In the future, Febe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina sells grocery products. Her husband, Ferdinand, is a farmer. When it is not cropping season, Marcelina supplements their income with her business selling different products such as snack foods, drinks, and spices. She buys the items from the market and carries them by her motorbike to resell in her village.

Marcelina wants to expand her business by purchasing more items like perfume, beauty goods, and electronic items for resale, so she is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to increase her capital. Marcelina and her husband have been married since 1995 and they have three grown up children.

loans.use: to buy perfume, beauty goods, and small electronic items for her business.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Felomina requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and other materials for fishing. She has been in this business for 29 years now.

In the future, Felomina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Glory Jean

texts.en:
Glory Jean is 30 years old and married with one child.

Glory Jean works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 29,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional stock of products to sell.

Glory Jean has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buying and selling recycled materials.

Glory Jean aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of products to sell.

loans.name: Almendrito Group

texts.es:
El grupo Almendrito está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 20 años en uno de los mercados de Managua. Ella comprara mercadería naranjas, limones, mandarinas, yuca, chayote…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Ángela del Socorro quien vende frutas y verduras desde hace 30 años y Jenny del Rosario quien vende perecederos desde hace 15 años.
texts.en:
The group "Almendrito" (Little Almond Tree) consists of three hardworking and enterprising women. Patricia has been selling fruits and vegetables for 20 years at one of the markets in Managua. She will buy merchandise such as oranges, lemons, tangerines, cassava, squash, and other produce.

The other members are Ángela del Socorro, who has been selling fruits and vegetables for 30 years, and Jenny del Rosario, who has been selling perishable goods for 15 years.

loans.use: to buy oranges, lemons, tangerines, cassava, squash, and other produce.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 41 years old and married with 2 children.

Leonora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Leonora has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Leonora aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. Rosemarie has been in this business for 5 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Mernalyn

texts.en:
Mernalyn is 35 years old and married with 2 children.

Mernalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling of rice grains in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Mernalyn has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling of rice grains for 8 years and also earns an income from avon dealing.

Mernalyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Maria Merlita

texts.en:
Maria Merlita is 48 years old and married with five children.

Maria Merlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Maria Merlita has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 21 years and also earns an income from raising livestock and selling DVD/VCD tapes.

Maria Merlita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Jill Mary

texts.en:
Jill Mary is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, shampoo, detergent and other groceries for her general store business.

Jill Mary has been in this business for 5 years. Jill Mary earns more income from E-loading.

Jill Mary has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, shampoo, detergent and other groceries.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 28 years old and married with three children.

Antonieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a coconut retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional coconuts to sell.

Antonieta has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the coconut retail business for two years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Antonieta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is from the village of Saranay. She is 41 years old. She is married and has four children. To make a living, Maricris engaged in poultry business. She usually raised ducks and chickens. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 150 PHP per head of her ducks and chickens.

At this time, Maricris  wants to avail PHP 13,000 to purchase ducks and more chickens to raise and sell in the village. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and more chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en: Vicente is 52 years old, married and had five children. To make a living, he sells plastic items such as basins, hangers, and other kitchen utensils. He had been doing it for over 10 years and approximately earn P4,000 each month. His spouse is a housewife. He is now asking for a loan of P6,000 to buy more stock pots, basins and dish cabinet to sell. These additional items would increase sales capacity in his business, thus increase his earnings too. Someday, he would like to improve the financial condition of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock pots, basins and dish cabinets to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. Susan is married and has a charcoal sales business in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more charcoals to sell.

Susan has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
At his age of 60, Francisco is still generating income for his family. He had six children but lives separately from them. He doesn't want to rely on his children's remittances so Francisco involved himself in selling plastic items. He offered his products on a house to house basis. Francisco's monthly net income was about P5,000.

He is availing for a loan of P6,000 to buy more basins, kettles and dish cabinets to sell. This will help increase his profits and ability to save funds to use when emergencies arise.

loans.use: to buy more blankets, basins, kettles and dish cabinets to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 31 years old and married. She engaged herself in a business selling basins, dish cabinets, and mats to the people in her neighborhood and goes to the nearby village to offer her products too. Her spouse is an Overseas Filipino Worker. She wanted to add to her spouse's income that is why she was in a business too. They had three children. Two are attending to school and the youngest is in preparatory school. 

As of now, she would like to sell more items to her customers so she is asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy basins, kettles, and steamers to sell. Someday she hopes to own a stall in the public market to conveniently offer her products.

loans.use: to buy basins, kettles, and steamers to sell

loans.name: Peniel Group

texts.es:
El grupo Peniel lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Reyna Isabel quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 1 ½ años, el crédito lo invertirá en granos básicos, productos lácteos, huevo, papel higiénico…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Silvia quien vende mercadería variado desde ropa y cosméticos y María Concepción también es comerciante de productos variados.
texts.en:
The "Peniel" group is made up of 3 hardworking and enterprising people.  One of them is Reyna Isabel, who's had a grocery store for a year and a half.  She will invest this loan in staple grains, dairy products, eggs, toilet paper, etc.

The other members of the group are Silvia, who sells a variety of merchandise including clothing and cosmetics, and María Concepción, who also has a business selling a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, dairy products, eggs, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Salvina

texts.en:
Salvina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing equipment. Salvina has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from culturing seaweed.

Salvina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the repair of her fishing net.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 39 years of age, married and has three children. She lives in Balintawak, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. Myrna used her last loan to purchase manure. Her business grew and became successful.  Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase more seeds, seedlings to plant and fertilizer for its production. Positively, she hopes for business progress.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds, seedlings to plant and fertilizer for its production

loans.name: Acela

texts.en:
Acela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Acela has been in this business for 10 years. Acela earns more income from farming vegetables.

Acela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store and raising pigs. Gemma is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing equipment for business

loans.name: Josiphine

texts.en:
Josiphine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment for her fishing/fish vending business.

Josiphine has been in this business for 21 years. Josiphine earns more income from ready to wear retailing.

Josiphine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment for business

loans.name: Ma. Mely

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Ma. Mely works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Ma. Mely is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and bamboo for her fishing business.

Ma.Mely has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and bamboo for her fishing business

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 50 years old. Jesusa is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Jesusa is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home used products in the local community. Jesusa has been in her business for 6 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Jesusa is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more items such as shampoo, toothpaste, etc. to sell. In 2011, Jesusa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as shampoo, toothpaste, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn has always wanted to provide a better standard of living for her family. For this reason, because her husband does not generate sufficient income to guarantee a good quality of life, Jocelyn decided to start a business selling personal products by catalog. She is married and the mother of 1 son who is 5 years old, for whom she wants to provide the best education possible starting at an early age. Jocelyn has, by means of her business, a very good alternate mode of generating income thanks to the fact that she can concurrently care for her son. Jocelyn learned this activity from a friend who had carried out this type of work for a long time and invited her to attend product promotional meetings. Thanks to the excellent attention Jocelyn offers, her business has seen sales increase considerably. She has been able to generate a good income and, little by little, improve her family’s standard of living. With the desire to deliver a large order from a client of hers, she must purchase the necessary products from her provider. However, she currently does not have sufficient capital to do this. For this reason, she has the hope that a loan will afford her the possibility to buy the personal products so that she can fill the large order that her customer has placed.

loans.use: to purchase personal products for her business

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 55 years old and married with 7 children.

Catalina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business of buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines and requested a loan of 21,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell. Catalina has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running this business of buying and selling rice grains for one year and also earns an income from a general store.

Catalina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima is married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jemima is 54 years old and one of her children is in school.

Jemima has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jemima requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Jemima has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. He works hard to support his family. Rodrigo has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials for his business.

Rodrigo has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, he would like to save enough money to afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing materials

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion, 51 years old, is married and has 3 children. She works very hard to provide for them. Salvacion has operated a retail peanut business in the Philippines for 10 years. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of peanuts to sell. In the future, Salvacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of peanuts to sell

loans.name: Iris Del Pilar

texts.es:
La Srta. Iris del Pilar, de 25 años de edad, es estudiante de la Universidad particular Sedes Sapientiae en la carrera de contabilidad. Ella le pone mucho empeño a sus estudios porque se ha planteado la meta de formar un estudio jurídico-contable al terminar su carrera, además de apoyar a su familia quienes le han brindado todo su apoyo y es su principal motivo para esforzarse y salir adelante.
El préstamo solicitado lo utilizará en el pago de matricula, mensualidad y convallidadción de cursos.
texts.en: Iris del Pilar is 25 and is a student at the private Sedes Sapientiae University.  She is studying for an accounting degree.  She puts a lot of effort into her studies, because she has set a goal of starting up a legal-accounting firm once she finishes her degree.  Her goals also include providing support to her family, because they have provided her with their total support.  This is her main motivation to work hard and succeed.  She will use the loan that she is requesting to pay for her enrollment fees, tuition and degree certification.

loans.use: to pay for her enrollment fees, tuition and degree certification

loans.name: Ema

texts.es: La Sra. Ema tiene 27 años no es casada pero es madre soltera ella tiene 3 hijos que son de las edades de 10,  4 y 2 años los dos primeros ya se encuentran estudiando. La Sra. Ema se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida  que se encuentra en uno de los mercados mas concurridos de la localidad, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ema utilizara este  préstamo para la compra de un refrigerador e insumos para el negocio la razón para solicitar este préstamo es no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para adquirir lo necesario, Ema  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la  competencia y ella quiere destacarse de la competencia ofreciendo un  buen servicio a sus clientes y así incrementar sus ventas y generar mas ingresos, se siente feliz y agradecida por al oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Ema is 27. She is not married but does have three children aged 10, 4 and 2. Her two older children already attend school.
Ema makes and sells food in one of the most visited markets in her community. This will be her first loan with our institution and she will use it to purchase a refrigerator and supplies for her business. She is asking for the loan because she can't afford to purchase what she needs. She faces several challenges in her business, such as competition, and she 'd like to differentiate through offering a good customer service, thus increasing her sales and obtaining a greater income. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity given.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and supplies for her business

loans.name: Socoro

texts.en:
Socoro is 50 years old, married, and has six children.

Socoro works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Socoro has borrowed and paid twenty loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for fourteen years and also earns an income from furniture making.

Socoro aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en: Bernadeth is married and she works hard to support her family. She has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines for 17 years. Bernadeth has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fish to sell. In the future, Bernadeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: 040406-Thôn Hải Sơn-Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kỷ operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase net for fishing .

Kỷ is 46 years old and she is married with 4 children..
She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 040406-Thôn Hải Sơn-Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

In 2002, Kỷ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Kỷ has successfully repaid 6 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Kỷ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main harship that Kỷ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Kỷ hopes to buy land of her own, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase net for fishing

loans.name: Merima

texts.en:
Merima, 41 years old, is from the town of Cabatuan. She is married and has four children. Merima owns and operates a food production business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of native cakes such as "puto" (a variety of rice cake) in the local community. Merima has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a week from it.

Merima is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy raw ingredients such as flour, sugar, bananas, cornstarch, etc. for her business. She believes that through her patience in managing the business she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as flour, sugar, bananas, cornstarch, etc.

loans.name: Flor Kantuta De San Roque Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR KANTUTA DE SAN ROQUE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por seis integrantes, que cuentan con una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Martha.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de chamarras, tejido de guantes de lana, comerciante de verduras, carpintería.

La señora Matha, indica que forma parte de la asociación por primera vez. Ya que ella cuenta con un negocio de tejido de chompas de lana. El crédito de este ciclo es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias paceñas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustó la capacitación en salud y crédito con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The Flor Kantuta de San Roque communal bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional office.  It is made up of six members who have a board of directors with Martha as the head.  The businesses carried out by the members of the communal bank are varied, among which we have sewing jackets, knitting wool gloves, selling vegetables, and carpentry.

Martha indicates that she is part of the bank for the first time, because she has a business knitting wool sweaters.  The loan in this cycle is to increase her capital buying wool that she will acquire in the markets in La Paz.  After making the sweaters she will sell on request.  This form of work helps her support her family because she is single and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she enjoyed the training on health and credit with her associates.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos adultos, tienen casa propia, ella administra desde hace 10 años una tienda de productos domésticos, este negocio surgió con la ayuda de su esposo, atiende a los vecinos de la zona, y su horario varía de acuerdo a la demanda. 
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para surtir el negocio, en pastas, condimentos, boquitas, galletas, pollo y detergentes, estos productos son demandados por sus clientes, por lo que este préstamo será de mucha ayuda para mejorar la atención.
La aspiración de Rosa es mejorar su condición en el negocio, ya que a través de él ha logrado proveer lo necesario para el hogar, siempre con la ayuda de su esposo.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her husband and three adult children in a home that they own. For the past 10 years she has been running a store where she sells home supplies. This business was started with help from her husband. She sells to people that live in the neighborhood and her schedule varies depending on demand.    

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to stock her store, including toothpaste, seasonings, snacks, cookies, chicken and detergents. These are all products which have high demand with her customers, which is why this loan will be of great help to improve her customer relations. 

The hope that Rosa has is that she will be able to improve her business, because it is by these means she is able to provide the necessary things for her home, as well as through the help her husband provides.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, seasonings, snacks, cookies, chicken and detergents.

loans.name: Finalyn

texts.en: Finalyn, 39 years old, is a simple and very industrious woman. She is married and has two children. Finalyn has been selling fruits and vegetables in the village for 6 years. She is very experienced in selling these products and would like a loan of PHP 7,000  to purchase fruits and vegetables that are in demand. Finalyn hopes to gain a higher income through this loan to improve her family's living conditions and to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Chona

texts.en: Chona is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She has 4 children. For the past 4 years, Chona has operated a family member's business, selling fish while her husband does the fishing. Her monthly earnings of 5,000 PHP help provide for her family’s daily needs. Chona is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to repair the fishing net used in the business. Chona joined GDMPC in 2011. She hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to repair a fishing net

loans.name: 06.06.05 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga has operated a retail business selling dry food and goods for 3 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more of these items to resell.

Nga, 24 years old, is the group leader of the 06.06.05- Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She is married and has 1 child. Nga lives with 1 dependent in Thanh Hoa, a city in Thanh Hoa province. This is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main hardship that Nga faces in her business is lack of capital. She plans to use her business profit to provide for her children and to buy more supplies and equipment for her business. Nga hopes for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase dry food and goods to resell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia, 45 years old married with three school aged children. She is involved in machinery rental for two years. Herminia is asking a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fuel and the extra money is for the maintenance of her machine. In the future, Herminia hopes that her business expand to give a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: for maintenance and to buy fuel for her business

loans.name: Krishan Mae

texts.en:
Krishan Mae is single and is 21 years of age. She finishes her degree in midwifery and is searching for a job that is suitable in her course. She had finished her education through the financial support of her father who is working abroad. 
Krishan Mae is the eldest child of her parent. She wishes that she could also help her mother in financial when she will get a stable job someday. While she is searching for a job, Krishan Mae wants to help her mother even in a simple way. In this connection, Krishan Mae is asking for a loan of P35,000 to buy feed for their hogs. She hopes that through the loan, her mother will lessen her worries in providing their hogs feed.
In the future, Krishan Mae hopes that she will get a stable job and able to help financially her mother.

loans.use: to buy feed for their hogs.

loans.name: 08.01.07 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thúy has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

Thúy is 35 years old and she is married with 2 children..
Thúy is the group leader of the 08.01.07- Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents

In 2010, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thúy has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Thúy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Thúy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 53 years old and is a married woman with three children. Her husband is a fisherman.

Milagros and her husband run a fishing business in Baclayon, Bohol. Milagros sells her husband's catch at their town's market. She sometimes goes out with her husband to fish. 

Milagros also sells "ginanggang" (grilled banana with butter and sugar) to her community. Milagros does her best to help sustain her family. 

She requested a loan to purchase light bulbs, a battery for a power source, and fishing nets. Milagros hopes her business will grow more.

loans.use: to purchase light bulbs for fishing, a battery for a power source, and fishing nets.

loans.name: 08.01.03 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoàn has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

Hoàn is 28 years old and she is married with 2 children..
Hoàn is the group leader of the 08.01.03- Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
Hoàn lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Hoàn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hoàn has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hoàn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoàn hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a hardworking mother who raises hogs for sale. She is married and blessed with two children who are presently studying. 
 
Jonalyn is now requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and medicines for her pigs. In providing those necessities and proper nutrition, she can produce profitable sales, wherein she can increase her income.

She hopes that her business will produce a stable income for the welfare of the family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando, 56 years old, is married and has six children, two of whom are still in school. His wife and the rest of his children are helpers in their carinderia (restaurant) business. They clean, wash the dishes, serve food, and buy ingredients while Fernando cooks and sells food for daily meals and snacks. He has decided to take out a loan of PHP 15,000 to improve his business. He will use it to buy meat, onions, vegetables and ingredients used to cook meals.

Fernando's aim is to maintain a good relationship with his family and with his customers to increase sales capacity that will someday lead him to the betterment of his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy meat, onions, vegetables and ingredients used to cook meals.

loans.name: Pricess Diana

texts.en: Pricess Diana is 20 years old and married.  She has been running her general store for four years and earns about PHP 250 a day. Pricess Diana is aiming to increase her profits due to expensive basic commodities and high electric bills. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles and biscuits for her store. She believes that she can improve her store with this loan.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles and biscuits

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es: La señora Araceli es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora propietaria de una mueblería junto a su esposo Martin, también tiene una pequeña pulpería desde hace 4 años. Ella con el crédito comprara un frízer lo que le permitirá agrandar la venta con la compra de otros productos.
texts.en: Araceli is the hardworking, enterprising proprietor of a furniture store, along with her husband Martin. They have also had a small local store for four years. With the loan, she will purchase a freezer, which will allow her to increase sales with the purchase of other items.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and other items to sell.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is from the village of Saranay. She is 24 years old and is married. Angeline has been engaged in her retail shop business for four years. She does her best to raise her family out of poverty.

Angeline is now requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional stock such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, curls, biscuits and soft drinks to sell. She believes that her patience and hard work will help her achieve her goal in life and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, curls, biscuits and soft drinks

loans.name: 08.01.06 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan has operated a retail business selling dry food and goods for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more of these items to resell.

Lan, 40 years old, is the leader of a 4-member group, the 08.01.06- Đông Vệ solidarity group. She is married and has 2 children. Lan lives and works in Thanh Hoa, a city in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

In 2010, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is lack of capital. In the future, she hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase dry food and goods to resell.

loans.name: Cristina Bernardo

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

É negociante há mais de 22 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (areia, cimento, barrotes, aros, portas, chapas e outros). Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00m1, 10.000.00mt, e 15.000.00mt, ambos para habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e mobilar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Cristina was born in the Boane district, Maputo province in southern Mozambique.  She is a single mother of 3 children who all attend school.  She completed school through the 7th grade but dropped out due to her parents' financial situation. She owns the home where she lives with her family and she does not support anyone else.  

She has been a business woman for over 22 years.  She earns around 5.000.00mt per month, which she uses for household expenses and savings in her bank account (BIM).

She has never had a loan with other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client.  This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase construction materials for her home (sand, cement, beams, wires, doors, metal sheets, etc.)

The prior loans were for 10.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, and 15.000.00mt, also for her house.  She promises to make her payments as scheduled.  In the future she plans to finish her home and furnish it, and she will request additional loans from Hluvuku for that purpose.

loans.use: To buy materials for her house; iron, beams, doors, metal sheets, etc

loans.name: Jenry

texts.en: Jenry, 32 years old, is from Poblacion, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is married and has one child. Jenry used his last loan to purchase new cell phone accessories and gadgets. His business has become successful and progressive. He is now taking a new loan to purchase new gadgets and accessories to expand product offering. He has positive hopes for more profit to support his family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase new gadgets and accessories to expand product offering

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is 41 years old and is married with three dependents. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Juanita used her last loan to purchase feed for her piglets. Her business is successful and she is requesting a new loan to purchase livestock to raise and sell. In the future, Juanita hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 47 years old and has two school-aged children. She sells fruits and vegetables in her village to supplement her husband's income. Juliet lacks sufficient capital and believes that, with her loan, she can improve her business through her patience and strong determination to make it a viable source of income.

Juliet is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan to buy different kinds of fruits and vegetables to sell. She aims to improve her family's living standard and become financially able to educate her children and give them a better life.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Elsa Raul

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 2 filhos que ainda não frequentam a Escola. Fez o nível médio do ensino geral e continua a estudar. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

É professora há mais de 5 anos e tem um salário de 5.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM). Já teve empréstimo no BIM e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (ferro, cimento, barrotes, portas, chapas e outros). O empréstimo anterior foi de 11.000.00mt, para habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir os seus estudos superiores, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Elsa was born in the city of Matola, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique.  She is married and mother of two children who don't yet attend school.  She completed her education through secondary school and is continuing her studies.  She owns the home where she lives with her family and she does not support anyone else.  

Elsa has been a professor for more than 5 years and she earns a salary of 5.000.00mt, which she uses for household expenses and savings in her bank account (BIM).  She previously had a loan through BIM and was able to pay it without any difficulties.  She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase construction materials for her home (iron, cement, beams, doors, metal panels, etc.).  The prior loan was for 11.000.00mt, also for her home.  She promises to make her payments as scheduled.  In the future she plans to complete her college education and intends to request additional loans from Hluvuku for that purpose.

loans.use: to buy materials for her house; iron, cement, beams, doors, metal sheets, etc

loans.name: Angeles Group

texts.es:
El grupo Angeles lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Aracely del Carmen quien se dedica a la venta de calzado desde hace 5 años. Este producto lo distribuye en Managua, Rivas y la frontera con Costa Rica. Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de cuero, cuerina, Brasil…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Gloria Isabel quien vende tortillas desde hace 5 años y Carlos quien tiene una taxi desde hace 6 años.
texts.en:
Angeles Group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people.  One of them is Aracely del Carmen, who has worked selling footwear for five years.  She distributes this product in Managua, Rivas, and the Costa Rica border.  She will invest the loan in buying leather, imitation leather, brazilwood, etc.

The other members are Gloria Isabel, who has been selling tortillas for five years, and Carlos, who has had a taxi for six years.

loans.use: to buy materials: leather, imitation leather, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 50 years old and blessed with five adult children. Despite being widowed, she has the determination to upgrade her family's living condition and give her children a better life. For the past six years, Norma has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store in her village to generate income, and she earns a monthly profit of 8,000 PHP. She usually spends her income on necessities and to support her youngest child's education. 

Norma is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan to buy inventory such as soft drinks, canned goods, junk food, seasonings, and beverages to sell. She hopes to use her loan to supplement her capital and increase her income. Norma will improve her business through patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy items such as soft drinks, canned goods, junk food, seasonings and beverages to sell

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman owns and operates a motorcycle transport business providing service to local community members. He is 32 years old and married with 1 child. He is from Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Arman has been in this business for 2 years and earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2011, Arman joined GDMPC. Arman is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase spare parts needed for his motorcycle. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts needed for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita lives in the San Pablo province of Isabela. She is 51 years old and married with seven children. 

Emerita is involved in hog raising. She has been in this business for 6 years. She is requesting this loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 41 years old and is married with four children. She is from Cabilinan, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. For the past eight years, Josephine has owned and operated a sari-sari (variety) retail store where she sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. She earns 8,000 PHP each month. Josephine joined GDMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Josephine is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase additional products to sell such as deodorant, soap, milk and other items. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to pay tuition fees for her children and to save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase products such as deodorant, soap, milk, and other items to sell

loans.name: Birama

texts.fr:
Birama, chauffeur  de taxi, propriétaire d’une Renauld 18, est client au guichet de Mbour 1 depuis un bout de temps. Son véhicule ayant rencontré une panne de moteur, Birama se tourne vers la caisse pour  solliciter un crédit de 200.000F CFA afin de changer celui ci.
Il est né en 1974, marié et père de famille. Après l’obtention de son permis de conduire, il a acquis son 1er véhicule avec l’aide de son père. Le transport est toute sa vie car il adore cela. C’est avec les revenus tirés de ce dernier qu’il réussi à faire vivre sa famille. Si la voiture est en bon état il n’a pas d’autres soucis en tête.
texts.en:
Birama, taxi driver and owner of a Renault 18, has been a client of Mbour 1 for some time now. Birama is asking for a loan of 200,000 FCFA in order to replace the engine of his vehicle, which has broken down.

He was born in 1974 and is now a husband and a father. He got his first vehicle, with the help of his father, after obtaining his driver's license. Transportation is his life; he loves it. He is able to support his family thanks to the revenue that he makes from working in transportation. As long as his vehicle is in good shape, he doesn't have any other worries.

loans.use: to buy an R18 engine for his taxi

loans.name: Maria Rita

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Manica, Centro de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais 2 ainda frequentam a Escola e os outros maiores de idade. Fez a 5ª classe e parou quando contraiu o matrimónio, e teve falta de tempo de prosseguir com os estudos. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 1 sobrinho que vive com ela.

É pensionista e negociante há mais de 10 anos e tem uma pensão de 4.571.00mt por mês, e um rendimento de cerca de 15.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
Já teve empréstimo na Procredito nos montantes de 15.000.00mt, 20.000.00mt,e 25.000.00mt ambos para habitação e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a conclusão da obra da sua casa (barrotes, aros, portas, chapas e outros).  
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e mobiliar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Maria Rita was born in the Manica province in central Mozambique.  She is married and has 5 children, 2 of whom attend school.  The others are adults.  She attended school through the 5th grade and stopped when she got married and did not have time to continue with her studies.  She owns the house where she lives with her family and she also supports one nephew who lives with her. 

She has been a pensioner and a businesswoman for more than 10 years.  She has a monthly pension of 4.571.00mt, and earnings of 15.000.00mt, which she uses for household expenses and savings in her bank account (BIM). 

She previously had loans with Procredito in the amounts of 15.000.00mt, 20.000.00mt, and 25.000.00mt, all for her home.  She was able to pay them back without difficulty.  She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client.  This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase construction materials to complete her home (beams, hoops, doors, metal panels, etc.). 


She promises to make her payments as scheduled.  In the future she plans to finish her home and furnish it, and she will request additional loans from Hluvuku for that purpose.

loans.use: to buy beams, doors, metal sheets, etc., for her house.

loans.name: Divino Rostro Group

texts.es:
El grupo Divino Rostro lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Juana Mercedes propietaria de una pequeña pulpería desde hace 4 años e invertirá el crédito en granos básicos, queso, café, papel…etc.
Las otras integrantes son María Auxiliadora quien comercializa bebidas y dulces tradicionales como pinolillo, pinol, cajeta…etc. Y Sandra Vanessa quien vende cosméticos y ropa usada.
texts.en:
The group 'Divino Rostro' [Holy Face] is made up of three members who are hard working entrepreneurs. One of them is Juana Mercedes, who has owned a small grocery store for the past 4 years. She will use the loan to buy basic grains, cheese, coffee, toilet paper, etc.

The other group members are Maria Auxiliadora who sells drinks and traditional sweets like pinolillo (a sweet traditional Nicaraguan drink made with ground toasted white corn and cocoa), pinol (a traditional drink) and cajeta (traditional candy that can be made with different flavors, including milk, pineapple and coconut), etc. The thrid member is Sandra Vanessa who sells cosmetics and used clothing.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cheese, coffee and toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is married and a loving father of his two children. Ruben manages a furniture making business. To further sustain his family needs, Ruben is engaged in a hog raising business. He has been in this type of business for almost five years and earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from it.

With the high cost of feed in the market, Ruben is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy feed for his pigs. Ruben's dream is to make his hog raising business stable for an additional source of income of the family. He hopes to make his dream a reality and be able to give the best quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is 53 years old and married with four children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past seven years, Prima has operated a transportation business. She provides services to local community members and earns 3,000 PHP each month. Prima joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.

Prima is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to repair one of her transport vehicles. In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle for her transport business

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Azucena es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de calzado desde hace 5 años. Ella comercializa especialmente sandalias y zapatos deportivos. El crédito que solicita es autoestima, este producto financiero se le otorga a las clientas para su uso personal ya sea para embellecerse, hacerse un chequeo medico…etc. 
Blanca Azucena invertirá el crédito  para realizarse un chequeo médico y unos exámenes que necesita.
texts.en: Blanca Azucena is a hard working woman who has made a living selling footwear for the past five years. Specifically she sells sandals and athletic shoes. The loan she is requesting falls under the category of self-esteem, this financial product is given to clients for personal use related to things such as  beauty, or to get a medical check-up, etc. Blanca Azucena will invest the loan in paying for a medical check-up and some medical exams she needs to have done.

loans.use: to pay for a medical check-up and exams.

loans.name: Ofelia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ofelia, vive con sus hijos y su esposo, se dedica a la venta de pupusas, meriendas y refrescos, tiene 2 años de trabajar en el negocio, surgió por iniciativa propia, como un medio para colaborar con su esposo en los gastos familiares.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de carretas de leña, tambien productos como maíz, aceite, condimentos, carnes, pollo, para realizar la venta de comida y pupusas, este préstamo le ayudara para mejorar y mantener en el negocio lo necesario.
Su objetivo es mejorar la capacidad del negocio, atraer más clientes para que sus ingresos sean mejores.
texts.en:
Ofelia lives with her children and her husband. She makes a living selling 'pupusas' (a traditional Salvadoran food made of a thick corn tortilla that is stuffed with a combination of cheese, meat and beans), snacks and drinks.
